title: How to Find & Capture Ho-Oh in Pokémon Emerald

steps.title: Play an emulated version of Pokémon Emerald.
steps.content: Play an emulated version of Pokémon Emerald. Since Ho-Oh’s MysticTicket event ended back in early 2007, you need to use an emulated version of Pokémon Emerald obtain this Legendary Pokémon. Delta Emulator is a great option if you have an iPhone, while GBA Emulator is a good option for Android phones. To play Pokémon Emerald on an emulator, you’ll need to find a copy of the game online (better known as a ROM). Use caution if you search for ROMs online, since downloading and using them technically qualifies as online piracy.

steps.title: Enter Master codes 00006FA7 000A 1006AF88 0007.
steps.content: Enter Master codes 00006FA7 000A 1006AF88 0007 . Open up the main menu in your emulator of choice—there should be some sort of “Cheats” menu. In the cheat code interface, submit the Master codes, which will allow your other cheat codes to work. [1] X Research source You may need to submit these cheat codes in two separate lines, like: 00006FA7 000A 1006AF88 0007

steps.title: Input code B749822B CE9BFAC1 A86CDBA5 19BA49B3 E9EF5CA7 0B0030CF.
steps.content: Input code B749822B CE9BFAC1 A86CDBA5 19BA49B3 E9EF5CA7 0B0030CF . This code basically tells your game to spawn a Ho-Oh when you encounter a wild Pokémon next. You may need to submit this code in 3 lines, like: B749822B CE9BFAC1 A86CDBA5 19BA49B3 E9EF5CA7 0B0030CF Alternative: Enter code 83007CF6 00FA to spawn and encounter a Ho-Oh in your game. Make sure the Master code is in place first! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Encounter a wild Pokémon in the game—it will be a Ho-Oh.
steps.content: Encounter a wild Pokémon in the game—it will be a Ho-Oh. Enter a patch of wild grass within your game, or any other place where you’re highly likely to bump into wild Pokémon. Your next Pokémon encounter should be with a Ho-Oh. Some players advise disabling the relevant cheat codes in the middle of your Pokémon battle to prevent any future corruption or glitching to your game.

steps.title: Enter code 842CB8A9 7F8B0149.
steps.content: Enter code 842CB8A9 7F8B0149 . Enter this code in your emulator’s cheat console, which should be accessible in the emulator’s main menu.

steps.title: Go through a door to teleport to Navel Rock.
steps.content: Go through a door to teleport to Navel Rock. Find any door in your game, whether it’s the door to an NPC’s home or the door to a PokéCenter. When you step through, you should automatically teleport to Navel Rock.

steps.title: Delete the code from your emulator after successfully teleporting there.
steps.content: Delete the code from your emulator after successfully teleporting there. If you don’t delete this code right away, some players warn that you can get stuck in the Navel Rock location.

steps.title: Head to the fourth floor of Navel Rock to encounter Ho-Oh.
steps.content: Head to the fourth floor of Navel Rock to encounter Ho-Oh. Make sure to save your game before encountering Ho-Oh, and then begin your fight. [3] X Research source What about Lugia? Head down to the basement level of the cave to encounter Lugia.
